data.text:
RT @charlotteharpur: Reaction pod to #ENGFRA, insight + mixed zone snippets from both teams.

The squad @David_Ornstein, @OliverKay, @JackP…

RT @AdamLeventhal: Day 22 @TheAthleticFC Football Pod 

Reaction to #eng’s World Cup exit after #fra loss inc @OliverKay @JackPittBrooke @D…
@LarsApel @Moxladington ha ok sorry for my sarcastic reply to you too :)
@Craig_Honeyman exactly mate that's why it's so much fun!

People will inevitably compare this to Croatia 2018, Netherland 2019, Italy 2021 but I don't think they're exactly the same. England were better and unluckier here than they were in those three games where they were all outplayed in the end.
@LarsApel Thank you so much for this illuminating tweet.

There's no getting past the fact that luck plays a big part in tournaments. What if Ospina saved Dier's pen in 2018! What if Muller had scored in 2020! What if Rashford's pen had gone in! What if England had got three pens tonight! We could do this all day etc etc
That game was better than any England performance at 2018 World Cup, or 2014, or 2010, or 2006 or 2002 ... you know where this is heading at this point...
The repeat final... it's on.
On an outcomes level getting knocked out at the QF isn't great but this was the best team England have faced in a game like this for ages and they were actually pretty good!

What a way to go out for England. Thought they were good overall, probably better than I expected, and got better as the game went on. At least as good at France. But... unlucky with decisions, finishing, fine margins really. That's just the contingencies of knock-out football.
And that is really what tournament football and experience and big-moment-ness is all about. France were nowhere for 20 minutes and now they're 11 minutes from the semi-final.
The longer this second half goes on the better England are looking. Dominating the ball, creating openings. France looking a bit short of ideas at the moment.
For me... I'd get Rashford on. Probably for Foden. England need to get a bit more direct.

The problem is that France are obviously 1-0 up and I'd say they look basically as likely to score in the second half as England do. Some of their counters are just one or two touches away from leading to a goal. England will need to be both good and lucky to get back into it...

Fascinating and high quality half. I think England played pretty well overall. Mbappe hasn't got in behind Walker yet (famous last words), Kane is causing Upamecano problems, Griezmann now on a yellow...
Devastating turn of pace from Mbappe past Rice in the middle there in the build up to that goal
For all the Mbappe v Walker talk, Dembele v Shaw proving the more worrying battle for England right now.
@abipaterson yep!
@MrDavidWhelan I'm thinking... inflatable spitfires and 'easy easy easy' chants?
@YesTom you'd be class mate. I'll ask Gianni
Oh cool they're now playing Ezra by Oneohtrix Point Never. (Lmao they're actually playing Chelsea Dagger.)
For more observations from up here, see our liveblog https://t.co/x3LrWfOGPK

urls.title: England vs France live updates
urls.description: England take on France in the World Cup quarter-finals today, in one of the standout ties of the tournament. England have scored 12 goals so far in Qatar, conceding only twice, while reigning champions France overcame Poland with ease to underline their intention of retaining their title. The game will also see two of the tournament’s in-form talents meet, in the guise of France forward Kylian Mbappe and England's teenage midfielder Jude Bellingham.We’re going to be joined by Charlotte Harpur, Tim Spiers, Amy Lawrence, Simon Johnson and Ahmed Walid as we preview today’s match. Get your questions in by emailing livebloguk@theathletic.com or tweeting @TheAthleticFC. Background readingFrance and England. Football teams created by immigration. Countries confused by it.Tottenham’s Kane v Tottenham’s Lloris: A World Cup duel beckonsWorld Cup bracket(Photo: Getty Images)

But ultimately I just think Brazil will overpower them. Croatia are good defensively but this Brazil team are a pretty unique combination of threats. Maybe if they don't get going and it's 0-0 at half-time... but I can't quite see that.

I did Croatia's games against Morocco and Japan and they clearly struggle in the final third against good teams. But they are very good at slowing the game down and playing at their own pace. The longer they can drag this out, the better. Maybe Brazil will panic.

tweets.text:
Day 22 @TheAthleticFC Football Pod 

Reaction to #eng’s World Cup exit after #fra loss inc @OliverKay @JackPittBrooke @David_Ornstein @charlotteharpur & @abipaterson & me at Al Bayt

Hear from England camp inc Southgate on future & Kane on penalty pain
https://t.co/1JkXK9AHwu
@Moxladington @JackPittBrooke Re-reading this tweets, that might actually be the case 😂 Sorry @JackPittBrooke

@JackPittBrooke Jack, LUCK plays a HUGE part in tournament football and I respect you for again pointing it out. Too many focus on substitutions or tactical tweaks when in fact it’s pure LUCK that sometimes wins the day and wins the game.

There's no getting past the fact that luck plays a big part in tournaments. What if Ospina saved Dier's pen in 2018! What if Muller had scored in 2020! What if Rashford's pen had gone in! What if England had got three pens tonight! We could do this all day etc etc
@JackPittBrooke Just for the record - you beat Iran, Wales and a Senegal-team without their best players. And drew with the US. And lost to the first time you faces a team of real quality.
That game was better than any England performance at 2018 World Cup, or 2014, or 2010, or 2006 or 2002 ... you know where this is heading at this point...
On an outcomes level getting knocked out at the QF isn't great but this was the best team England have faced in a game like this for ages and they were actually pretty good!
It's getting likelier by the minute!

What a way to go out for England. Thought they were good overall, probably better than I expected, and got better as the game went on. At least as good at France. But... unlucky with decisions, finishing, fine margins really. That's just the contingencies of knock-out football.
And that is really what tournament football and experience and big-moment-ness is all about. France were nowhere for 20 minutes and now they're 11 minutes from the semi-final.
The longer this second half goes on the better England are looking. Dominating the ball, creating openings. France looking a bit short of ideas at the moment.

The problem is that France are obviously 1-0 up and I'd say they look basically as likely to score in the second half as England do. Some of their counters are just one or two touches away from leading to a goal. England will need to be both good and lucky to get back into it...

Fascinating and high quality half. I think England played pretty well overall. Mbappe hasn't got in behind Walker yet (famous last words), Kane is causing Upamecano problems, Griezmann now on a yellow...
Devastating turn of pace from Mbappe past Rice in the middle there in the build up to that goal
For all the Mbappe v Walker talk, Dembele v Shaw proving the more worrying battle for England right now.
@JackPittBrooke I missed Toploader????

it’s like entering a time capsule  where Gazball never happened. A world of the 2000s, sambuccas and Heskey shirts. People talking about Tottenham’s run to the League Cup. Whispers of some “Canadian” lad that plays for Bayern Munich
@JackPittBrooke Really enjoying my first day as the World Cup DJ
Not even joking: Toploader are on the pitch here playing Dancing in the Moonlight.

Kylian Mbappe vs. Kyle Walker has been billed as the battle that will decide #ENG vs. #FRA 

Mbappe has been at his scintillating best in Qatar; not many players can cope with his speed & brilliance.

But one who can - as Mbappe has hinted himself - is Walker.

📝 @JackPittBrooke
gazball’s time is now. https://t.co/T6og9rY2Sc

We end by marking the sad passing of Grant Wahl & send our condolences to all that knew & loved him. https://t.co/j8b96Apwxc
It's happening. It's literally happening.

@JackPittBrooke Hi. I'm Lee from South Korea. I read ur article <Are England actually good?(...)>. U wrote "And in Kylian Mbappe they have one of the two men who has played like a god since the start of this tournament." Then who is another one? I think he is Lionel messi. right?

urls.title: Grant Wahl 1974 – 2022
urls.description: We are all devasted at the news of Grant Wahl’s passing while covering the World Cup in Qatar.Grant was a friend to so many FWA members and one of the most respected journalists in the world.His passion and dedication to football was unparalleled and the insight he brought to his coverage unsurpassed.He was a trusted […]

Day 21 @TheAthleticFC Football Pod

Focus on #eng #fra with @JackPittBrooke recorded this morning. We end by paying tribute to Grant Wahl who will be sorely missed by so many here & around the world. We extend our condolences to his family, friends & fans.
https://t.co/gGtyGjylKR

LeBron James offered his remembrance of journalist Grant Wahl tonight in Philadelphia. Wahl, who died at the age of 48 while covering the World Cup in Qatar, wrote the first Sports Illustrated cover story on James - “The Chosen One” - when LeBron was still a teenager. https://t.co/mZIMx1TJiB

What devastating news. The loss of a brilliant journalist and wonderful person. An example and inspiration to so many. On behalf of the @theofficialfwa, sincere condolences. RIP. https://t.co/Clr0K0Onpm

I’m grateful to Grant Wahl for helping me make it as a soccer writer, but I’m more grateful that his urge to help people who could use his help extended all throughout soccer and way beyond it. I hope we live up to that.

urls.title: Jordan Pickford’s invisible saves are England’s secret World Cup weapon
urls.description: Three of the Everton goalkeeper’s finest saves for England in Qatar have gone unnoticed by the match officials as international football continues to bring out the best in him

urls.title: An alternative analysis of the World Cup - by the man who helped shape Guardiola's City
urls.description: At the World Cup, teams' styles are too similar, there are no bad or exceptional players and James Maddison is a genius

urls.title: World Cup 2022 live updates: Day 14
urls.description: Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the first day of the knockout stages in the Qatar World Cup.Today sees a huge game for the USMNT against the Netherlands, before Australia take on Argentina.Background reading World Cup fixtures and full scheduleWorld Cup standingsWorld Cup knockout bracketYour guide to every team at Qatar 2022Why the Qatar World Cup is controversialWorld Cup 2022 — a beginner’s guide: Every question you’ve been too afraid to ask(Photo: Getty Images)

tweets.text:
How Goncalo Ramos playing on the last man for Portugal helped generate a space that Switzerland just didn't bother defending.

It had been very different against Uruguay with Ronaldo coming deep to link play.

Santos' ballsy call paid off handsomely 🇵🇹

➡ https://t.co/B9VVtOINJq https://t.co/lQDnTf5wDp

urls.title: Portugal - Cristiano Ronaldo + Goncalo Ramos = Freedom
urls.description: Fernando Santos's decision to drop his biggest, and most problematic, player has broken the shackles on his team at the World Cup

tweets.text:
One of the World Cup’s most controversial moments & one of its greatest goals.

But how good was Diego Maradona against England in 1986?

In the first of our World Cup reconsidered series, @Zonal_Marking re-evaluates the Hand of God and that brilliant second goal 🇦🇷

"How's Qatar?" people ask.

Well ...

I've seen some great football. Stadiums stunning! Lovely food! Friendly people! Everything so convenient for journalists.

But ... there are so many "buts". They mustn't be ignored just because we're having a nice time https://t.co/ShKK5gy1Ug

urls.title: FIFA want us to see the light - but World Cup in Qatar remains under a dark shadow
urls.description: Even if the football has been a success - off-pitch events, including another death of a migrant worker, leave the World Cup under a shadow

tweets.text:
Mauricio Pochettino on how to stop Harry Kane:

“Always be focused on where Kane drops because he will find Saka, Foden, Grealish, Rashford. If he turns with the ball, you need the defensive line to drop quick."

#ENGFRA | #FIFAWorldCup

Mauricio Pochettino, the only man to have managed Harry Kane and Kylian Mbappe, on the two men who could decide England vs France on Saturday.

"Kane needs to be connected with the game. Kylian is the opposite. If he doesn't touch the ball, he’s relaxed."

#ENGFRA | #FIFAWorldCup

An @TheAthleticFC investigation: 

A Filipino migrant worker died during the World Cup group stage at Saudi Arabia’s training resort in Qatar. He suffered a fatal blow to the head after a fall in a forklift accident.  

Read: https://t.co/eU08RNRJl3

urls.title: Migrant worker died in accident on World Cup base during group stage
urls.description: Filipino man fell working on Saudi team base in incident that was covered up and highlights the continual concerns over working conditions
